headline.main: FINNS AIDING THE GERMAN CAMPAIGN; They Tie Up Many Red Army Divisions And Cut Railroad

lead_paragraph: STOCKHOLM, Oct. 11 -- Finland joined Germany in the attack against Russia, first and foremost, in order to recover territories lost to Russia during the 1939-1940 war. But at the same time the Finnish war machine has a direct and important part to play in Reichsfuehrer Hitler's war plans.
abstract: Finnish aid in German campaign discussed
